name: Wyndham Vacation Resorts Asia Pacific Sydney

reviews.title: not luxurious but decent
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in January 2005. The lobby is tiny and not particularly impressive, and the corridors look like they need a facelift but the rooms are actually not bad. We had a decent-size studio with a kitchenette and a bathroom and I also saw a one-bedroom suite, which was quite large. No, there's no cable TV and only four coat hangers in the closet, but location makes up for a lot: it's an easy 30 min walk to the Sydney Opera House and 5 minutes to George St or Oxford St shopping and entertainment. Give the very basic breakfast buffet a miss and go to one of the many coffee places in the vicinity. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. This is a good place for those who are not looking for luxury but want decent accommodation at an acceptable price.

reviews.title: Great location no frills hotel.
reviews.text: I recently stayed four nights in the Southern Cross Suites hotel in Sydney. The websites give it anywhere from 3 to 4.5 stars. I would say between 3.5 to 4 to honest. If you are looking for a high end Luxury hotel along the lines of the Four Seasons or Park Hyatt this is not the hotel for you. If you are looking for a decent hotel in a good location, then I would recommend this hotel. You enter through a small no frills lobby. The staff is friendly and knowledgable and there is a small cafe on site. I was upgraded from a standard suite to a one bedroom suite. The room was very large with a seperate bedroom and even a small kitchen. It reminded me of a typical long term business hotel suite. Much like, a courtyard marriot or extended stay hotel. The location is really the selling point of this hotel. It is just on the south end of hyde park...one block south to be exact and within a block of the museum subway stop. Circular Quay, the airport, Olympic park are all within an easy train ride from this location. Oxford st which contains a number of pubs and dance clubs is only a short walk away. If you are traveling with kids, there are even a few movie theatres and malls within walking distance. Let's face it...when you are on vacation....how much time do you really spend in the hotel room? As I mentioned...decent no frills hotel in a great location....save some money...stay here and treat yourself to a great night on the town......

reviews.title: Southern Cross Suites is a No Frills Hotel.
reviews.text: My family spent 8 nights in this hotel in September, 2003. We were disappointed in its quality. It is not a bad hotel, but is very average. The lobby is very small and plain for a hotel in a large city. Our travel agent told us there was an on-site restaurant, bar and room service. There is no bar. The restaurant is a very small cafe with a limited menu, counter service only and which closes in the afternoon. The morning breakfast buffet there never varied in its limited selection and was quite bland. When I hit the room service button on my room phone, I got the front desk. I was told I needed to find the pamphlet in the hotel information booklet and call one of the 2 delivery services advertised there. The delivery service company will go to a set list of area restaurants then deliver food to your room. It requires an outside phone call, and as far as I can tell neither are affiliated with the hotel. Claiming this is room service is a bit of a stretch. Any local hostel can also give guests these pamphlets. The furnishings in our room were also drab and seemed worn. The hallways could use fresh carpet and wall paper as well, as these are also clearly worn with age. There is no swimming pool. There is a pool service available for a fee, which is less than a 10 minute walk. However, if you are trying to entertain children during a rain storm, leaving the hotel to go swimming is not ideal. The staff was friendly and courteous though. And check in and check out was efficient. My complaint is that I feel they claim to be much more "luxurious" than they are. There are also several nearby "adult" themed bookstores and bars, which can be awkward to walk pass when you bring your children. I definitely do not recommend this hotel for families with young children.

reviews.title: Great time
reviews.text: This is not a glamourous hotel, so don't expect any frills as you'll be disappointed.

My mother and I stayed here between August 4 and 16. We had been booked into a studio suite, but because they realized we wanted two twin beds, we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. The price was good.
reviews.title: Very small rooms!

reviews.text: We stayed there for a week on the tail-end of our holiday around asia and australia, and we enjoyted ourselves greatly! We stayed on the 13th floor and had a nice view of a office over the road, and the room was very nice, we were accustomed to hostels and were surprised to find a clean, modern looking room with a lovely bathroom and a deep bath! We thought the breakfast was sufficient and fuelled us for a days walking, and as far as room service, we just ordered pizza from Domino's.....they had the pizza with us in 15 mins!!!!!! (Good service). There was a great cheap bottle shop nearby, and not an eyebrow was raised every morning when the staff came to clear out the VB bottles we left.........the only real complaint we had was regarding the fire alarm, which conveniently went off at 7am on the first two days of our stay, evacuating in my spongebob squarepants pj's is not cool (im 22, should know better)....all in all i would definately stay again, and will recommend the hotel to my friends and my enemies.
reviews.title: They didnt mind the mess I made
This is good, and no frying indeed
reviews.text: I was wary before booking this hotel since it didn't get very good review, However I decided to give it a try anyway and booked an one-bedroom room for 4 night for AUD$90 per night (that's a steal). My partner and I arrived at about 12pm but they let us check in early. The lobby was quite insignificant and the corridors leading to our room indeed looked old, but we were pleasantly suprised when we entered our room. Here is what we liked and disliked about the hotel:

- The room is not as old as other travellers had suggested, ok new carpert might be good, but we found our room very well maintained otherwise. The room contained a kitchen, lounge room, bedroom, and a bathroom with tub (great way to relax after a day's walking).
reviews.title: Only managed one night

reviews.text: - The small kitchen was great, the utensils were very clean and newish and there was everything that we needed to make meals. Previous traveller mentioned not to use the frying pan, this time they didn't provide any. Instead, there was a sign saying "kitchen is not suitable for frying as it may generate excessive smoke"... :D
reviews.title: Spacious but Shopworn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this Apart/Hotel once before when it was the Southern Cross Towers. Since then, Wyndham have taken it over and spent 2 years refurbishing. It has just been completed and now offers totally modern and stylish accommodation. Stayed in a one bedroom suite, with a fully equipped kitchenette, large bedroom with king bed and a separate lounge/dining area. Flat screen TVs in bedroom and lounge, and a DVD player in the lounge. A spacious bathroom with large walk-in shower (no bath). Desk internet & safe, laundry facilities on 3 floors. Overall, a very pleasureable stay after moving from a very cramped, much more expensive room in the Rydges just 2 blocks away. Situated next to Chinatown and near Darling Harbour and Hyde Park. Wished we'd found this sooner and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

aka: Wyndham Vacation Resorts Asia Pacific Sydney Hotel Sydney
description: Wyndham Vacation Resorts Asia Pacific Sydney is located in Australia’s largest and most exciting and diverse city, Wyndham Sydney offers spacious accommodation in the heart of it all. This stylish, modern hotel is within easy walking distance to all major attractions and just a short stroll from Hyde Park and the popular restaurant precincts of Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Surry Hills and vibrant nightlife of Oxford Street. Each apartment features a kitchenette and Juliet balcony (excluding Studio apartment), spacious living area with LCD television, a large bedroom and modern en-suite designed to meet the need of both business and leisure.
